data.title: good food..service bad.
data.text: The place was busy ,so service was slow..but at least water could have been put on the table. or at least come back and say something as to how long the wait.

data.title: One of my favorites
data.text: Fresh fresh fresh seafood. A hidden gem in deerfield across from city hall. Everything is great. I eat here at least once a week. I hope the owner will had a ceviche boat of some sort in the future. But if you go for lunch be prepared to sit outside. It's worth every drop of sweat. I always order the red tigers milk as an appetizer and mix ceviche as entree both extra spicy and I regain my taste buds with their delicious mango flan dessert. Try the purple corn aid beverage.refreshing. they are doing it right. I wish I can get them delivered to me in Boca but Boca delivery dudes or deerfield DD won't just travel right across the bridge.

data.title: Fish filet topped with Seafood Sauce . . .
data.text:
This time i want to share an amazing dinner consisted of Mahi-Mahi Filet, topped with a seafood sauce, this is no doubt the best dish i have tried thus far from Chef Rodolfo, teh responsible party at the La Panza Latin Bistro, an Inka Kola and a desert of Bavarois, 
One word?? . . .W o w ! !  . . . 
Not only that i was satisfied with my dinner, but there is something about the food , the ambiance, attention and the people there leaves me wanting to come back and counting the days . . . like no other restaurant.
Savory, firm meat, super white wild caught  fish, Mahi-Mahi (locals call it Dolphin, not to be confused with the cetacean mammal), makes for a tremendous lean protein with a mild and unique flavor.
The sauce . ..  a seafood based sauce with all the trimmings, i believe simple is better, that alone makes the Peruvian cuisine one of the best in the World, crazy world filled with many non value fast food and even fine restaurants with non value menus.
I must say, i loved every bite of it.
An amazing experience, an even better dinner, I recommend it without hesitation.
again, Excellent!!

data.title: Great food but tacky place
data.text:
Excellent Peruvian inspired dishes, with some twists added by the owner/chef, not all of which are improvements on the original. For example, the ceviche and tigers milk come with toasted peanuts, which I could have done without. But the seafood is very fresh and well prepared. Also, the lomo saltado is among the best I've ever had.
The restaurant itself is in a low rent strip mall and the inside akin to an old style diner. Pricing is very competitive and the portions very generous.

data.title: Authentic Peruvian, great food!
data.text: Best for takeout, it is a little small and best as a stop after the beach.  The food is excellent quality. Try the "Causa" cold dish of mashed potatoes flavored with lemon and hot peppers stuffed with crab salad, chicken salad, or others. Probably the best I have had,  in Peru or here.  The ceviche is also top quality super fresh. The waitresses are very friendly, overall the staff is sometimes stressed but always willing to please. Sometimes there is a long wait but totally worth it for the freshness. Do not skip the delicious desserts.

data.title: Worse services ever!!! Never going back there!!!
data.text: I was there yesterday with my family , first time too that I went there and the service was the worse plus we got some attitude from the owner of the restaurant that was so disrespectful and childish and very rude to us , plus he was screaming to his waitresses right in from of everyone, my worse experience in a Spanish restaurante and I won't never go back there to eat ever again , it sucks!!!'

owner_response.author: CEBICHE-LOVER, Manager at La Panza Latin Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Iam Sorry that you feel that way. We treat everybody with respect, and we expect everybody to treat us that way. We are a small restaurant , and our tables accommodate a maximum of 4 guests. However,in special occasions we can place 2 tables together to accommodate more guests.However, that has to be done by Restaurant personnel only, and the tables have to be next to each other. I remember that you showed up with a party of seven or more,and you were told by the waitresses that there was a wait because the restaurant was at its full capacity. Some people of your party started carrying the tables from the patio area from one side to the other. We do not allow customers to carry tables on top of their heads and move them around. After moving the outside tables around, your party decided to seat inside the restaurant since there was a large table that got cleared. Even though that there were other guests that were waiting for that table, your party decided to take that table.After going inside, your party left all the outside tables and chairs wherever they wanted. They were other guests that had to wait for somebody to go outside and place all the furniture back in place. I told my personnel to not let customers to do whatever they wanted. Iam sorry that you could not understand what we meant. You would not if somebody goes into your house and started taking the furniture to the streets, or started doing whatever they want. WE TREAT EVERYBODY WITH RESPECT, AND WE EXPECT TO BE TREATED WITH RESPECT TOO!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great dining experience!
data.text:
The ambiance is as usual, very intimate and always very good.
Ordered Arroz Chaufa de Mariscos, seafood fried rice.
Though it was a little heavy on the ginger, it was not overbearing and a welcome change of pace of culinary  routine.
The seafood was very fresh and cooked to perfection.
The mixed ceviche (mysterio) was nothing short of amazing, made with Mahi-mahi, it just felt right and almost healing.... 
Desert, bavarois de guindones was also an unexpected surprise of flavors, sweet, prunes and the secret crème sauce ... WOW!!!
Beat dinner I had in a while.
I need to go back soon...
Need my therapeutic Ceviche!!
Loved it 😎

data.title: where was the dinner crowd?
data.text: this little place is wonderful, friendly, a good deal, as fresh as fresh can be. I asked my lovely Peruvian waitress why there were no other diners and she answered that they do a fantastic lunch business but close early. The owner came out to help me select and then make the ceviche-which was delicious and served with peruvian corn kernels(huge). You also get these to munch on pre meal-roasted.  I could not finish my ceviche, but ordered another dish anyways-as it sound solo good....fresh tuna surrounded by yellow potato mash/topped with a hard boiled egg and avocado. I ended up taking both home for lunch today-and both were delicious once again...no etoh, but ok to bring your own plus they have tiger milk(will try that next time)

data.title: A peruvian Gem hidden
data.text: Family owned and hard to find in the heart of Deerfield beach. A small and modest peruvian restaurant BUT the food is awesome! Have to go and enjoy.!

data.title: Excelente
data.text: Excelente este restaurante de comida peruana es lo mejor de Deerfield!! el servicio impecable y muy buenos precios.

data.title: Excelente comida y servicio
data.text:
Llegamops a este restaurant siguiendo los review de Tripadvisor, 
Exclente opcion para comer comida peruana.
desde que nos sentamos una muchacha muy amable Emperatriz, nos atendió super.
La comida, muy sabrosa, abundante y a precios razonables.
Noas gusto mucho que el dueno y chef visita las mesas para intercmabiar opiniones con los comensales.
Definitivamente volveremos

data.title: El mejor ceviche en USA
data.text:
Un pequeño restaurant peruano que ofrece el mejor ceviche, lomo saltado y leche de tigre que he probado en USA.
El ceviche lo prepara Rodolfo, el dueño que es peruano, delante de uno con un estilo muy peruano (como los buenos ceviches de carretilla de antaño)
Un sitio para comer rico y pasarla bien. Y si quieren datos del mejor Surf en Florida, pregpuntenle a Rodolfo.
